p: Severe fever with thrombocytopenia syndrome (SFTS) virus (SFTSV) is an emerging viral pathogen classified within the Huaiyangshan banyangvirus species, Banyangvirus genus of the Phenuiviridae family ( 1). First reported in China in 2009 ( 2), cases of SFTS disease and subsequent virus isolations have been described in Japan ( 3), South Korea ( 4 – 6), and more recently in Vietnam ( 7). The virus is considered by the World Health Organization to be a pathogen “likely to cause wide epidemics” and requires urgent scientific attention to be directed toward the development of antiviral therapies and novel vaccines ( 8, 9).
